title: 15 States Announce Historic Teacher Salary Increases for 2026
introText: Fifteen states have announced significant teacher salary increases for 2026, addressing chronic underpayment that has driven educators from the profession. Average raises exceed 15%, with some states establishing $60,000 minimum salaries.

content.content: States including Texas, Florida, and Arizona will raise teacher salaries by an average of 15-20% in 2026. Several states have established $60,000 minimum salaries for starting teachers.

Teacher shortages reached crisis levels in many states, with schools unable to fill positions in math, science, and special education. Higher salaries aim to attract new teachers and retain experienced educators.

States are using a combination of budget surpluses, federal education funds, and new revenue measures to fund the raises. The investments represent the largest coordinated teacher pay increases in decades.
